Description: Numeric identifier for each hospital; used as the primary key in the dataset.
Official name of the hospital or medical center.
Street address of the hospital’s primary location.
City where the hospital is located.
Two-letter state abbreviation (for this dataset, always GA).
Five-digit ZIP code for the hospital’s address.
Name of the Georgia county where the hospital is located.
Five-digit FIPS code for the county, stored as text to preserve leading zeros.
Decimal latitude coordinate used for mapping and spatial filtering.
Decimal longitude coordinate used for mapping and spatial filtering.
Indicates whether the hospital is classified as Urban or Rural.
Flag indicating whether the hospital is part of a larger health system (1 = in system, 0 = independent).
Name of the health system the hospital belongs to, if applicable.
Hospital ownership category (e.g., Nonprofit, Government, For-profit).
General level or type of care provided (e.g., Primary, Specialty, Regional Referral, Acute Care).
Approximate number of hospital beds; used for size comparisons and filters.
Categorical size band based on bed count (e.g., S, L, XL, XXL).
URL for the hospital’s website or a search link when a direct URL is not available.
Score (1–5) indicating how well the hospital balances financial growth with mission-driven priorities.
Score (1–5) representing financial transparency and reporting practices.
Score (1–5) reflecting overall fiscal stability and financial health.
Score (1–5) indicating adequacy and stability of staffing levels.
Aggregate category rating (1–5) for Finance, Transparency, Investment, and Hiring (FTIH) metrics.
Score (1–5) representing how effectively tax benefits are used in support of community obligations.
Score (1–5) for the quality of community benefit spending (CBS).
Score (1–5) indicating how strategically community benefit and related resources are deployed.
Aggregate category rating (1–5) for Community Benefit Spending metrics.
Score (1–5) reflecting the financial burden on patients (e.g., affordability, billing practices).
Score (1–5) indicating the level and adequacy of charity care provided.
Score (1–5) representing hospital performance related to medical debt (e.g., debt practices, relief).
Aggregate category rating (1–5) for Hospital Affordability and Billing (HAB) metrics.
Score (1–5) reflecting the breadth of services available at the hospital.
Score (1–5) indicating how well services align with the needs and demographics of the community.
Score (1–5) representing investment in workforce development and training.
Score (1–5) reflecting pay equity within the hospital system.
Aggregate category rating (1–5) for Healthcare Access and Social Responsibility (HASR) metrics.
Final overall performance rating (1–5 stars) used for rankings and comparison.
List of key clinical and support services offered; stored as a newline-separated string.
Example Value:
Emergency Care\nImaging & Radiology\nOutpatient Surgery\nPharmacy\netc…
OR
Emergency Care
Imaging & Radiology
Outpatient Surgery
Pharmacy
etc…
